meanings.definition: To treat or combine with ammonia.
meanings.sent1: The farmer ammonified the soil to help the plants grow.
meanings.sent2: The scientist carefully ammonified the chemicals in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally ammonified the soup, creating a strange smell.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to be gently ammonified with kindness.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion was said to be ammonified with mysterious ingredients.

meanings.sent1: The bacteria in the compost pile slowly ammonified the organic matter.
meanings.sent2: The waste materials were ammonified by the natural processes in the environment.
meanings.sent3: The old book seemed to have been magically ammonified into a new edition.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were ammonified into groundbreaking innovations.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creativity seemed to be ammonified by the beauty of nature.

meanings.sent1: The organic matter in the soil began to slowly ammonify.
meanings.sent2: The dead leaves were left to naturally ammonify over time.
meanings.sent3: The classroom atmosphere seemed to suddenly ammonify with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her mood started to slowly ammonify as the day went on.
meanings.sent5: The music in the room seemed to be ammonifying the emotions of the listeners.
